issues.description: The template repository's ArrayHelpers defines a method named appendElement(T[], T) while the template's Stock class calls ArrayHelpers.addElementToArray(...). This is a self-contradiction in the template (method name/signature mismatch) that will cause compilation errors for students and prevents them from using the provided helper to modify arrays. The solution repository uses the name addElementToArray, showing the intended API, but the template does not match that API.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the helper API consistent in the template. Either rename the method in template ArrayHelpers from appendElement to addElementToArray (matching the solution and the Stock usage), or change Stock.addToStockIngredients to call ArrayHelpers.appendElement. Preferably rename/replace ArrayHelpers.appendElement to public static <T> T[] addElementToArray(T[] array, T element) (and keep removeFirstElementFromArray) so the template compiles and matches the intended solution API.

issues.description: The helper method used to append an element to an array is named inconsistently between files. In the template Stock class, code calls ArrayHelpers.addElementToArray(...), but the template's ArrayHelpers class defines the method as appendElement(...). The solution repository (intended final state) uses addElementToArray(...). This mismatch between ArrayHelpers' method name and the call site in the template will produce compilation errors and prevents students from mapping the 'append element' concept to the provided helper method.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the append/adding helper name consistent. Either rename the template ArrayHelpers.appendElement(...) method to addElementToArray(...) (preferred, to match the Stock usage and the solution) with signature public static <T> T[] addElementToArray(T[] array, T element), or change the call in Stock.addToStockIngredients(...) to ArrayHelpers.appendElement(...). Aligning names across the template and solution will remove the compilation error and reduce student confusion.
